column1: Systemic racism is a public health crisis.    Addressing longstanding inequities in our health care system must be an essential component of our COVID response and overall healthcare policy. https://t.co/gaUDiE8htm
The coronavirus pandemic is far from over. Please continue to do the little things to keep each other safe.   Wear a mask wash your hands and practice social distancing.

The coronavirus pandemic continues to take a devastating toll on children and their education.    This American Education Week we must renew our commitment to providing our schools with the resources they need to avoid learning disruptions and keep students and teachers safe.
The U.S. reported a record-breaking 153000 COVID cases yesterday.  We are still in the middle of a pandemic.   Do your part by wearing a mask avoiding crowds and practicing social distancing.

COVID is still raging. Hunger poverty and inequality are all on the rise.   Congress must pass additional COVID relief – it was needed months ago and is still needed today.   It is time to get back to work.
COVID is still spreading in Ohio and across the country.  Wear a mask. Practice social distancing. Wash your hands. Be kind.

Today the Senate will try to push through a Supreme Court nominee just eight days before the election.   This is unconscionable especially since the Senate has yet to pass COVID relief for struggling Americans.

Black and Brown Americans are more likely to get sick and die from COVID-19 lose their jobs fall into poverty and struggle with hunger.  Comprehensive COVID relief isn’t just some “nice-to-have” for communities of color – it’s a matter of life and death.

31 states in the “red zone."  4 more than last week.  13 more than last month.  Private reports obtained by @COVIDoversight show the White House knew cases were surging yet continued to publicly downplay the threat of the virus—costing lives and livelihoods. https://t.co/laxG1HVXQs
The Coronavirus pandemic is far from over.    Ohioans: please continue to wear a mask wash your hands and practice social distancing.  https://t.co/ui5FhA0KHX
COVID-19 cases are rising in Ohio and across the country again.    Don’t forget to wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands.

Instead of considering the additional COVID relief our country needs the Senate is holding Supreme Court hearings today.  No stimulus checks. No federal unemployment extension. No aid for schools or nutrition.  All on hold while the Senate rushes through a Supreme Court Justice.

The Administration played down the danger of COVID-19 to children while refusing to provide schools with the funding they needed to safely reopen.   Putting our children’s safety at risk is unconscionable. https://t.co/1y4qpMbA3Q

Around 26 million people are receiving some form of unemployment aid.  17 million children didn’t have enough to eat this summer.  More than 200000 Americans are dead.  Yet the Senate is prioritizing a #SCOTUS vacancy over COVID relief that would help everyday Americans.
If Republicans approached the pandemic with the same urgency they show confirming a Supreme Court Justice we could have passed another round of COVID relief months ago.

This compromise will help to keep the government open but it is no substitute for a comprehensive coronavirus relief package.  I call on Senate Republicans to pass this bill and then come back to the negotiating table to address the full scale of this crisis. (4/4)

Systemic racism is a public health crisis.    #COVID has exposed and exacerbated the deep health disparities in Black and Brown communities.  Addressing these inequities must be central to our COVID response. https://t.co/G65SeZ0WFl

Hundreds of House-passed bills are sitting on Senator McConnell’s desk collecting dust.  ➡️COVID Relief ➡️Justice in Policing Act ➡️John Lewis Voting Rights Act ➡️USPS Funding ➡️Climate Action Now Act ➡️#RaisetheWage Act ➡️Preexisting Conditions Protections … just to name a few.

The President admitted to misleading the public about a pandemic that has killed nearly 200000 Americans. Meanwhile a COVID relief bill with $75 billion for testing tracing and treatment has been sitting on Mitch McConnell’s desk for 118 days.

March 19: 12600+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 265 confirmed COVID deaths in U.S.   Today: 6334150+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 189970+ confirmed COVID deaths in U.S.   The President downplayed the threat posed by the coronavirus costing thousands of lives. https://t.co/knnxLmWrA6

The National Institutes of Health and its partners are working to ensure all Americans can easily access #COVID19 clinical trials and benefit from the resulting treatments & vaccines.   Learn more and sign up today by visiting https://t.co/2pu1ICwkZ7.

#BREAKING: The House just passed the Delivering for America Act to protect the USPS and ensure Americans can safely exercise their right to vote amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Proud to stand with my colleagues in taking action to protect this essential service.  #DontMessWithUSPS

This week the House will be back in session to #SaveTheUSPS.  The Senate should be back too.  And while we’re at it let’s reach an agreement on a COVID relief bill to help schools reopen safely and protect families from hunger eviction and financial ruin.

Ohio like other states can’t afford to pay the extra $100 unemployment benefit due to COVID’s devastating impact on its budget.  Federal benefits will be cut in half and take weeks to be delivered.  #ExtendUI https://t.co/s8VA6oQLMC

Wearing a mask in public is one of the best ways to protect yourself and slow the spread of #COVID19.   This #WorldMaskWeek and every week and every day #WearAMask and encourage your friends and family to do the same. https://t.co/LX4WmwLU70

At meat plants across the country COVID outbreaks have threatened the health of workers many of whom are from immigrant communities and communities of color.  My Safe Line Speeds in COVID-19 Act would help to protect worker safety during the pandemic. https://t.co/2G6qrmFrRR

Rent is due and many families don't know how they're going to make payments amid #COVID19. The Republican Senate's failure to act means that millions could soon lose the roofs over their heads.   We must extend the eviction moratorium & provide relief to renters. https://t.co/jtEZbFvPK4

As programs work to reopen safely the bill will also help to support Head Start teachers and uplift vulnerable children and families impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.  For more information on the Head Start Extended Duration Grants Act visit https://t.co/OctAO9NP4i

The COVID-19 pandemic has dramatically worsened child hunger in the U.S.  That’s why I introduced a new bill with @BobbyScott to provide free school meals to all students during the pandemic.    No child should have to learn on an empty stomach. #SchoolMeals4All https://t.co/hwXOzHFCF3

The Child Care for Economic Recovery Act will help working families & support ongoing employment by:  - Helping more low- and middle-income families afford care - Supporting providers struggling financially from coronavirus - Increasing federal investment in child care (3/3)

As COVID-19 cases continue to surge we need a diverse public health workforce capable of testing tracing and treating the disease in all communities. My new Pandemic Community Reserve and Public Health Response Act will help us combat the pandemic & prepare for future crises.

As we near 4 million COVID-19 cases in the U.S. and 150000 deaths the Administration has all but given up on finding solutions to end the crisis.  Without funding to test trace and track #COVID we won’t be able to contain the pandemic let alone get our economy back on track.

Congress must be able to legislate #ForThePeople through emergencies like #COVID19. Today @HouseAdm_Dems are exploring the technological and security issues surrounding remote voting in the House. https://t.co/3SOLuqK1O4

We don’t have to choose between risking lives and closing schools.   The #HeroesAct would provide $100 BILLION in funding to help schools address the impact of #COVID19 and cover unexpected costs as they work to #ReopenSafely. https://t.co/i7DfbXowI8

Congress has approved over $3 trillion in federal spending to combat the #coronavirus pandemic.  Help us ensure that your tax dollars are being spent properly.  Report any fraud waste or abuse of relief funds by visiting https://t.co/e8oyctnYbT or calling 202-225-4400. https://t.co/rV21uFTg1b

Across the country meat processing plants have become COVID-19 hotspots.  Fast line speeds make dangerous conditions worse by packing workers closer together.  Proud to introduce the Safe Line Speeds in COVID-19 Act to protect worker food and animal safety during the pandemic.
Looking for a #COVID19 testing site? @OHDeptofHealth has an interactive map of testing sites across Ohio that can help you find the location nearest you. https://t.co/XFPzFrogiW

Black and Latino Americans have been 3X more likely to become infected with #COVID19 and 2X more likely to die from it than white Americans.   Our response to this crisis must confront the long-standing inequities that exist in every region of the country. https://t.co/4bDFyebP4e

Today is National Postal Worker Day. Join me in thanking our 650000 postal workers for their tireless efforts to keep people and our communities connected especially during the coronavirus pandemic.  Congress must continue to support these essential workers and #ProtectTheUSPS.

Millions are still unemployed and COVID-19 cases are surging again.   Stimulus checks have been spent.   Unemployment benefits are expiring.   Schools are in dire need of support to safely reopen.   Inaction is not an option—the Senate needs to take action on the #HeroesAct now.

Let me be clear: In the middle of a pandemic the President is urging the Supreme Court to strip health care from 20+ million Americans and remove protections for pre-existing conditions such as COVID-19.  https://t.co/vlHhiHppnp

They say viruses don’t discriminate.  True but the coronavirus didn’t have to.  Black and Latino Americans were already facing longstanding racial disparities in their daily lives that made it more likely they would get sick and die from #COVID19.  https://t.co/jGaZCcVvyh

Each and every day more people become sick lose their jobs struggle to put food on the table and fall behind in school.  The House passed the #HeroesAct over a month ago to address the impacts of the coronavirus but the Senate is yet to act.  People need help now.
Wear a mask. Practice physical distancing. Wash your hands frequently.   Remember businesses may be reopening but the threat of the coronavirus has not passed.

Around 40% of Cleveland families have no reliable access to high-speed internet.  At today's @EdLaborCmte hearing on COVID's impact on education I had the opportunity to ask Eric Gordon CEO of @CLEMetroSchools about the resources needed to ensure successful remote learning. https://t.co/dvLKdN5ahA
ATTENTION: @GovMikeDeWine has announced that all Ohioans who want a COVID-19 test can now get one regardless of symptoms.   To find a testing site near you visit: https://t.co/ZFVEdbackL

HAPPENING NOW: The Committee on House Administration Elections Subcommittee hearing on the Impact of #COVID19 on Voting Rights and Elections -  and how to ensure voters have safe fair access to the ballot box in November.   Follow along at https://t.co/PV4KcMT3zu.

Today I am back in Washington D.C. to chair an Elections Subcommittee Hearing on how to ensure voting is safe and accessible in November in light of the coronavirus pandemic.   Watch live at 1 PM ET by visiting https://t.co/PV4KcMT3zu.

Tomorrow at 1:00 PM ET I will chair a Subcommittee on Elections hearing on the impact of #COVID19 on our elections and how to ensure voters have safe fair access to the ballot box in November.  For more information and to watch live tomorrow visit https://t.co/YVBMC3ByTq.

FCI Elkton has been a coronavirus hotspot threatening the health and safety of inmates and staff alike. I joined @RepMarcyKaptur @RepTimRyan and @SenSherrodBrown in urging @OfficialFBOP to do more to stop the spread of #COVID19 at Elkton and protect everyone at the facility. https://t.co/6n3DjmAY71

Responding to the census helps ensure our communities’ fair share of funding reaches schools hospitals and hunger programs—more important than ever as we recover from the coronavirus pandemic.  Read my op-ed in @Essence on what the #2020Census means for communities of color. https://t.co/6126rK0Tbv

More than 100000 lives have been lost in the U.S. to #COVID19.  They aren’t just a statistic—they are mothers fathers grandparents friends neighbors and colleagues.  To all those who have lost loved ones we stand with you during this difficult time. #DayofMourning

African Americans are dying from #COVID19 at a rate three times higher than white people and have been more likely to lose their jobs or wages.   We need resources in minority communities to prevent racial disparities from becoming worse than they were before this crisis hit. https://t.co/Qrrkb3qXfW
For more information on the Protect our Children from COVID-19 Act visit https://t.co/dzitmAH0qv.

Getting students back to school is critical to making up for lost time but it must be done in a way that protects the safety of students and teachers alike.  My new bill with @RepAGonzalez supports safe school reopening by requiring research into how children transmit #COVID19.

The President signed an executive order last month calling for meat plants to re-open without outlining a clear plan to protect food workers.  Since then coronavirus infections at meat processing plants have soared and worker deaths have nearly tripled. https://t.co/gJzyilKOaL

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our families and communities.   As we continue to confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. https://t.co/LgQ023zI6V

May is Asian Pacific American Heritage Month.    This month let us not only celebrate the contributions of the Asian American and Pacific Islander communities but also speak out against hate-filled comments and crimes towards Asian Americans relating to #COVID19.

While devastating communities across America the pandemic is exposing deep racial inequalities.  African Americans are more likely to die from #COVID19 work in essential jobs that put them at risk and lose their wages or jobs as a result of the crisis. https://t.co/uRfMkkeaE1

The coronavirus pandemic highlights the importance of participating in the census.  Census results are used to allocate billions of dollars in funding each year for hospitals schools and emergency relief.  Complete your census today by visiting https://t.co/IuGY7MEJU8.

CDFIs play a critical role in expanding economic opportunity to underserved communities yet have been largely left out of the small business relief to date.  Proud to lead 27 of my colleagues in calling for funding to be set aside for CDFIs in the next #COVID19 response bill. https://t.co/6YtiEoL3L2

Thanks to the Affordable Care Act it is illegal for insurance companies to deny coverage or charge higher premiums to those who have recovered from COVID-19.  However the Administration continues to support a lawsuit that would dismantle the entire ACA. https://t.co/2wZh7fEIp0

The coronavirus pandemic is creating a workplace safety crisis for health care postal grocery store and meat plant workers.  We need strong safety protections for workers – no one should have to decide between their health and a paycheck.   https://t.co/gXL969fjkf

The meat processing industry has been devastated by #COVID19 with infection hotspots appearing in plants across the country.  Proud to join @repcleaver & 46 of my colleagues in urging the Adm. to put forward a clear plan for how it plans to protect frontline food workers. https://t.co/4pHS6ZZrrg

Proud to join @davidcicilline @Jimpressoffice & more than 100 of my colleagues in calling for support for local news outlets during the coronavirus information.  Reliable and accurate reporting that keeps our communities informed is more important than ever. https://t.co/xH3nCvKQiy

The meat packing industry has been devastated by COVID-19.  The absence of a clear plan from the Administration to protect and adequately compensate frontline food workers is irresponsible dangerous and will lead to more preventable illnesses and deaths. https://t.co/ME4OaRi8J1

Too often workers are forced to choose between their jobs and their safety.    Never has this been more apparent than during the coronavirus pandemic.    Essential workers deserve strong workplace protections including PPE and hazard pay. #WorkerMemorialDay

Did you not receive an absentee ballot that was requested before the April 25 deadline?   You are eligible to vote in person at the Board of Elections today until 7:30 PM.   Arrive early to avoid lines and remember to social distance.

Prisons in Ohio and across the country are quickly becoming coronavirus hotspots.  Prisoners have rights and no prisoner deserves to die in jail of #COVID19.   We need to make sure incarcerated individuals are afforded appropriate care and safe conditions during this crisis.

The coronavirus is disproportionately infecting and killing minorities across the nation.  I joined @CedricRichmond @SenKamalaHarris & @SenGaryPeters in demanding FEMA address racial disparities in its response to the pandemic and ensure equitable delivery of aid and assistance. https://t.co/4B3J1CHQRu

BREAKING: The House just passed an interim coronavirus relief bill to increase funding for small businesses hospitals and testing.  While this helps small businesses keep people on payroll  and protects health care workers far too many people are left out of this package.

Brave first responders and health care workers from Northeast Ohio are not only fighting the coronavirus pandemic in our community many have also traveled to hot spots like New York and Michigan to help our fellow Americans in need. #InThisTogether. https://t.co/YKqxCDk5Al

The coronavirus crisis is causing unprecedented hunger for students laid off workers and families.    We need to boost SNAP benefits & suspend the Administration’s harmful proposals to cut SNAP eligibility.

It’s National Volunteer Week. Thanks to all the volunteers who are making a difference in our community every day and especially during the coronavirus pandemic from our volunteer first responders to the heroes staffing our food banks and delivering meals to seniors.

Students without access to digital devices or internet are struggling to keep up as their classrooms turn virtual during the coronavirus pandemic.   I’m proud to lead my colleagues in calling for increased funding for distance learning for students in high poverty areas. https://t.co/pLB5TSmJRK

Ventilators are critical to helping patients with COVID-19 breathe but have been in short supply during the current pandemic.   Three Cleveland companies joined together to develop a breathing pump that can lower demand for ventilators across the country. https://t.co/0L5hDIaJ3G

Essential workers across the country are putting themselves in harm’s way to keep us going during the coronavirus pandemic.   These workers deserve wages that reflect the essential services they provide. https://t.co/bnBXNxaJhK

The workers stocking groceries working in warehouses and delivering packages are among the unsung heroes keeping us going during #COVID19.   Proud to join @RepCartwright in introducing a resolution supporting hazard pay and promoting safe workplaces for essential employees. https://t.co/Ud5E4K0Rjf
REMINDER: Due to coronavirus the deadline to file federal and Ohio state taxes has been moved to July 15.  To learn more visit https://t.co/vVWBmTSuFM.

Hand-washing is critical to preventing the spread of coronavirus.  The pandemic is showing why access to water is a right not a luxury.  I joined with @RepJohnKatko & 35 of my colleagues in urging leadership to address water affordability in any future #COVID19 relief packages. https://t.co/4dZEbyuOto

The coronavirus pandemic is exposing longstanding health disparities in America.  One glaring example of inequality in our health care system is the maternal health crisis impacting Black mothers and babies.

More than 37 million Americans struggled with hunger before the coronavirus pandemic.  That number is increasing daily as unemployment surges and students have limited access to school meals.  We need to boost SNAP benefits for children & families now.  There is no time to waste.

#OTD 55 years ago the Elementary and Secondary Education Act was enacted into law affirming the right of every child to a quality education.  Today schools turning to online learning during the #COVID19 pandemic is a reminder that we still must ensure no student is left behind.

I’m proud to cosponsor a resolution introduced today by @RepEBJ & @RepLouCorrea recognizing the harmful health disparities faced by minority communities and urging the publication of racial and ethnic data concerning #COVID19 testing and treatment. https://t.co/lbABEIb8Bd

The coronavirus pandemic is starkly exposing the health disparities in America.   To begin to address the inequities and ensure resources are being distributed fairly during this crisis we need to understand the full extent of the problem we face today.

Are you or someone you know a college applicant wondering how the coronavirus has affected the admission process? @NACAC has created a new database to provide real-time information on changes to admission events & decision deadlines. https://t.co/A5xI12YaFM

Early data shows Black Americans are significantly more likely to become sick and die from coronavirus.  This crisis is creating inequality while exacerbating longstanding injustices in access to health care housing healthy food & economic opportunity. https://t.co/u8WvLhvHjS https://t.co/lBZhOSKgYM

Thank you to @OHNationalGuard for helping to save and protect lives by preparing our Ohio medical system for a surge of coronavirus patients and distributing food to hungry families.  https://t.co/AVeJ9q74xX
Thanks to @CLE_State for donating critical PPE to help keep health workers in Northeast Ohio safe as they continue to fight coronavirus. https://t.co/nRTH0Z6T8q

The coronavirus is exacerbating inequality and exposing racial disparities in health.  Vulnerable Americans and communities of color need equal access to testing & treatment.  Going forward we must address the inequalities that endanger the health of poor & minority communities. https://t.co/u3yWM5M9wp

Millions of Americans already face barriers to voting.  With the ongoing coronavirus pandemic it is imperative states take swift action to make voting safe and even more accessible to ensure every eligible voter can be heard in November. https://t.co/505ftq9HWJ

Community Health Centers are on the frontlines of the fight against the coronavirus. We need to make sure they have the resources needed to continue to care for the low-income and uninsured Americans they serve. https://t.co/WczIhm0kZ1
Did you miss my #coronavirus telephone town hall last night? You can listen to a recording of the call on my Facebook page by visiting https://t.co/5cUP2kj9hW.
HAPPENING SOON: My #coronavirus telephone town hall is about to begin.   Call 877-229-8493 (PIN: 116718) to join or stream on Facebook by visiting https://t.co/vcpOXee74u. https://t.co/IY0XoOQU79
HAPPENING TODAY: At 6:00 p.m. I will host a #coronavirus tele-town hall to provide updates on #coronavirus pandemic and answer your questions. #COVID19 https://t.co/IY0XoOQU79

Proud to join members of the Ohio delegation in urging @USDA to approve @OhioJFS’ application to operate the Disaster Household Feeding Program. By giving food banks additional flexibility the program will help protect the health of Ohioans and reduce the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/x9KNzTl7W1

The #CARESAct included $350 billion in relief for small businesses impacted by coronavirus. @SBAgov has issued new guidance and loan resources on the programs now available to small businesses across the country.   For more information visit  https://t.co/9wKDyWWvDQ.

Schools moving to online learning.  Employees working remotely.  Americans filing for unemployment.  Telehealth playing a crucial role in stopping the spread of coronavirus.  This pandemic is exposing the digital divide and demonstrating why broadband access is a basic necessity.

On Thursday I will host my second #coronavirus telephone town hall.    @RepBarbaraLee; Gil Goldberg Regional Director of @SBA_Cleveland; and Bruce Madson Assistant Director of @OhioJFS will join me to provide updates and answer your questions. https://t.co/XfhXhJSjIk

The President has approved @GovMikeDeWine’s disaster declaration request. This will unlock critical funding for state and local governments and voluntary organizations working to respond to the unprecedented challenges associated with the ongoing coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/dva9M6iFVU

At a time when workers are facing layoffs pay cuts and dangerous working conditions due to the coronavirus pandemic the Administration is working to make it harder for workers to unionize. This is unacceptable. https://t.co/h6vH6eByFo

Ohio needs critical federal assistance to effectively respond to the unprecedented coronavirus pandemic.   I’m proud to join my colleagues in urging the President to approve @GovMikeDeWine’s request for a major disaster declaration for the state of Ohio. https://t.co/V1QKfZpGlo

Last week Congress passed the CARES Act to address the grave threat from the #coronavirus pandemic.  My latest newsletter includes information on the provisions in this package for individuals small businesses and students. For more information visit https://t.co/55j4VEmztB https://t.co/Q4X1nOhQle
Recently lost your job in Ohio as a result of the #coronavirus pandemic?   Visit @OhioJFS’ page to obtain FAQs and instructions on how to apply for unemployment benefits: https://t.co/gugJQuLqz0

SAVE THE DATE: Next Thursday April 2 at 6:00 p.m. I will host my 2nd telephone town hall to answer your questions related to #COVID19. I will also provide updates on the CARES Act the latest #coronavirus developments and the resources available to you & your family. https://t.co/OtNziM4RaU
Throughout the #coronavirus outbreak blood donations are still needed.  Blood centers are taking precautions to ensure your safety. For more information visit https://t.co/QWlwYOvyFv.

Americans who were already struggling to make ends meet are being devastated by #coronavirus. Now is not the time to collect on delinquent taxes & unpaid student small business and HUD loans. Proud to join @RepBonamici in calling on @stevenmnuchin1 to suspend these collections. https://t.co/mb4ULlMjTn

The continued reference to the coronavirus as the “Chinese Virus” and “Wuhan Virus” is not only blatantly xenophobic it is dangerous to the Asian American community.  Proud to support @RepGraceMeng’s resolution condemning anti-Asian sentiment racism related to #COVID19. https://t.co/8mvGVoBo5b

ATTENTION: There are a number of rumors circulating about untested treatments for #coronavirus.  Always consult with your doctor before taking any measures that go beyond the @CDCgov’s recommendations which can be found by visiting https://t.co/kGB1e9K9An.

It’s past time for the President to implement the Defense Production Act to address medical supply shortages.  Proud to join @RepTimRyan & @RepSlotkin in introducing legislation to ensure health care workers have the protective equipment they need to fight the #coronavirus. https://t.co/xFN2lVpKm0

Health care workers are critical to combating the #coronavirus pandemic. The @DeptVetAffairs is now able to rehire retired VA health workers to help treat veterans as we continue to address this public health emergency.   To apply visit: https://t.co/dxa0gpQiGr
Unable to participate in my #coronavirus telephone town hall last night? You can listen to a recording of the call by visiting https://t.co/bWF44ljDJ0.

I commend @Ford @GM @3M and other companies who are stepping up to produce much-needed personal protective equipment. We must ensure health care workers have the masks and PPE they need while they fight #coronavirus on the front lines. https://t.co/eogdz9DMaS
HAPPENING SOON: My #coronavirus telephone townhall is about to begin. Call 877-229-8492 (PIN: 116718) to join. https://t.co/BCLUvpHRu2

In the face of a public health crisis like the #coronavirus affordable and accessible health care is as important as ever before.  It ensures Americans can receive the testing and treatment they need to prevent the further spread of disease in our communities.
Ohio has issued a stay-at-home order for all residents to contain the spread of #coronavirus.   If you have questions about the order visit the @OHdeptofhealth FAQ page at https://t.co/eLSIE94peX

HAPPENING TODAY: At 4:00 p.m. I will host a #coronavirus tele-town hall to provide updates on the current health crisis. Local infectious disease experts will also be available to answer your questions. #COVID19 https://t.co/BCLUvpHRu2

On Monday March 23 at 4:00 p.m. I will be hosting a tele-townhall to provide updates on #COVID19. Joining me will be @RepRichardNeal Chair of the House Ways and Means Committee and health experts from @SummaHealth and @metrohealthCLE. https://t.co/KkgP8QcD9T

I sent a letter with @BobbyScott today urging @USDA to implement the Pandemic EBT provisions included in the #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act.  The Dept. must ensure low-income children who depend on school meals receive assistance as quickly as possible during closures. https://t.co/6diTf7CMl3

NEW: Small businesses and nonprofits in Ohio suffering hardship from the #coronavirus can now apply for low-interest long-term loans through the @SBAgov disaster loan program.    For more information and to apply visit https://t.co/htvX7v8y3O.

Health care workers need medical supplies and personal protective equipment to fight #coronavirus.  I sent a letter with @RepSpeier and 64 of my colleagues asking what the President is doing to utilize DOD resources to combat this epidemic. https://t.co/WBMw5YeuAN

Residents of #OH11: A new page on my website contains up-to-date information and resources that may be helpful to you and your family during the coronavirus pandemic.  Visit https://t.co/rWSZ8mjc7M for more information.
.@ClevelandClinic has launched a new online #COVID19 screening tool. To find out your risk level and appropriate care recommendations visit: https://t.co/8BFSavmXOo

UPDATE: The Senate finally passed the Families First  #Coronavirus Response Act to guarantee free testing improve paid leave and expand food access. This is great start but Congress can and must do more to protect the safety health & financial security of Americans.

Thank you to the doctors nurses public health workers firefighters and EMTs who are on the front lines caring for patients and working hard to combat the #coronavirus crisis.  We are forever grateful for your service and sacrifice. https://t.co/YViYDlo5eb
Ohio has a new #COVID19 hotline.   If you have questions regarding #coronavirus call @OHdeptofhealth at 1-833-4-ASK-ODH (1-833-427-5634) for answers.

The #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act:  ➡️Protects student access to nutritious meals during school closures ➡️Ensures low-income pregnant women and mothers with young children have access to food ➡️Supports local food banks  It’s time for the Senate to pass this bill.

The President is working to gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions strip food assistance from our most vulnerable and cut funding for Medicare & Medicaid.  These actions would have dire consequences for Americans especially during the #coronavirus pandemic.
If you lose your job during the #coronavirus pandemic you can apply for benefits online at https://t.co/q6BFsOeaMb.    #COVID19 https://t.co/djV3Q7VugL

How can you do your part during the #coronavirus outbreak? ✔️Practice social distancing ✔️Stay home if you are feeling sick ✔️Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds ✔️Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects https://t.co/2V3lu6F5R8

I applaud the quick response to #coronavirus by @ClevelandClinic & @UHhospitals who have partnered to provide drive-through #COVID19 testing.  The testing site will be open 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. for patients with a doctor's order from UH or Cleveland Clinic. https://t.co/QnBq8PzaDG

BREAKING: The House just passed a #coronavirus package to strengthen food security initiatives guarantee free COVID-19 testing provide paid leave and strengthen unemployment benefits.   The Senate must move on this bill to provide much-needed relief to the American people.

As schools across Ohio close to slow the spread of the #coronavirus ensuring students can continue to access healthy affordable food is critically important.  School meals are often the only meals some students receive each day. https://t.co/avhhUf9crc
